textbooks.title: Pharmaceutical Statistics: Practical and Clinical Applications

topics: Sampling distributions. Estimation of Population Parameters.
Tests of Hypothesis for A Single Sample
Tests of Hypothesis for Two Samples
Statistical Process Control and Process Capability.

grading.scale: A: 90% and above, B: 80% and above, C: 70% and above, F: Below 70%
grading.policies: Grades for late submissions will be reduced unless you ask for an extension in advance with a good reason.

assignments.description: Weekly problem sets due on Sunday of the corresponding week.
Initial discussion submission due on Thursday of each week; participation by commenting on at least one post by Sunday.
Term paper/project details will be posted during the course.

policies.late_work: Grades for late submissions will be reduced unless you ask for an extension in advance with a good reason.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must adhere to the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: Online lectures, weekly readings, homework submissions, and discussions.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Minitab Statistical Software rental costs $35.99 for 6 months and $57.99 for 12 months.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Disability Services for accommodations, CAPS for mental health support.

course_info.title: Statistical Methods in Life Science Industries

_metadata.course_description: This course is focused on the application of statistics and statistical reasoning in pharmaceutical and life science manufacturing.
learning_outcomes: demonstrate familiarity with common statistical concepts
analyze life science manufacturing processes using the above mentioned concepts and statistical software
assess laboratory and in-process measurement methods and determine their precision and accuracy
develop and evaluate sampling plans for process validation and quality control
implement statistical process control methods in life science manufacturing
utilize design of experiments in process development and validation
